<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62578D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Plan Administration
</I>
	. Our Board of Directors or our compensation committee administers our
	share incentive plan and determines the terms and conditions of awards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Types of Awards.
</I>
	The following is a summary of the awards
	that may be granted under our 2008 Share Incentive Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Options.
</I>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
	Provide for the right to purchase our ordinary shares at a specified exercise price subject to vesting, and generally will become exercisable in four equal annual installments beginning on
	the first anniversary of the date of grant.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Restricted Shares.
</I>
	&nbsp;A sale of ordinary shares at a price determined by our board or our compensation committee or a grant of our ordinary shares, in each case subject to vesting terms.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Restricted Share Units.
</I>
	&nbsp;Represent the right to receive our ordinary shares, subject to vesting. Restricted share units will generally be settled upon vesting, either by our delivery to the holder of the
	number of ordinary shares that equals the number of the vested restricted share units or by a cash payment to the holder that equals the then fair market value of the number of underlying ordinary shares. If any of the restricted share units that
	are settleable in Class B ordinary shares expire without settlement, such underlying Class B ordinary shares will be automatically converted into Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares and such Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares so converted will become available
	for future issuance under our 2008 Share Incentive Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Award Document.
</I>
	&nbsp;Awards granted under our share
	incentive plan are evidenced by an award document that sets forth the terms and conditions applicable to each of these awards, as determined by our board or compensation committee in its sole discretion.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Termination of the Share Incentive Plan.
</I>
	Our 2008 Share Incentive Plan will terminate in August 2018. Our Board of Directors may amend,
	suspend, or terminate our 2008 Share Incentive Plan at any time; provided, however, that our Board of Directors must first seek the approval of the participants of our share incentive plan if such amendment, suspension or termination would adversely
	affect the rights of participants with respect to any of their existing awards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Changyou.com Limited 2014 Share Incentive Plan
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In June 2014, our board of directors and our shareholders adopted our 2014 Share Incentive Plan. In November 2014, our board of directors
	approved an increase in the number of Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares reserved for issuance under our 2014 Share Incentive Plan and invoked the &#147;home country practice&#148; exception to the Nasdaq Listing Rules to approve such increase without
	shareholder approval. See &#147;Risk Factors&#151; Risks Related to Our Class&nbsp;A Ordinary Shares and ADSs &#151;&#148; in Item&nbsp;3 of this annual report. Our 2014 Share Incentive Plan provides for the issuance of up to 6,000,000 Class&nbsp;A
	ordinary shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Plan Administration
</I>
	.&nbsp;Our compensation committee, or our board of directors in the absence of such a
	committee, will administer our share incentive plan. The compensation committee or the board of directors, as appropriate, will determine the provisions and terms and conditions of our awards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Types of Awards
</I>
	.&nbsp;The following briefly describes the principal features of the various awards that may be granted under our 2014
	Share Incentive Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Options
</I>
	.&nbsp;Options provide for the right to purchase our Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares at a specified exercise price subject to vesting according to a vesting schedule determined by our board or our
	compensation committee and provided in an award agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Restricted Shares
</I>
	.&nbsp;A restricted share award is the sale of Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares at a price determined by our board or our compensation committee or a grant of our ordinary shares, in each case
	subject to vesting terms.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Restricted Share Units
</I>
	.&nbsp;Restricted share units represent the right to receive our Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares, subject to vesting. Restricted share units will be settled upon vesting, subject to the terms
	of the award agreement, either by our delivery to the holder of the number of Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares that equals the number of the vested restricted share units or by a cash payment to the holder that equals the then fair market value of the
	number of underlying Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Award Document
</I>
	.&nbsp;Awards granted under our share incentive
	plan are evidenced by an award document that sets forth the terms and conditions applicable to each of these awards, as determined by our board or compensation committee in its sole discretion.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Termination of the Share Incentive Plan
</I>
	.&nbsp;Without further action by our board of directors, our 2014 Share Incentive Plan will
	terminate in June 2024. Our board of directors may amend, suspend, or terminate our 2014 Share Incentive Plan at any time; provided, however, that our board of directors must first seek the approval of the participants of our share incentive plan if
	such amendment, suspension or termination would adversely affect the rights of participants with respect to any of their existing awards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	84
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage87"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62578D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Conversion Cash Bonus Plan
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On July&nbsp;10, 2012, 7Road adopted the 7Road 2012 Share Incentive Plan, which initially provided for the issuance of up to 5,100,000
	Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares of 7Road (amounting to 5.1% of the then outstanding 7Road shares on a fully-diluted basis) to selected directors, officers, employees, consultants and advisors of 7Road. On November&nbsp;2, 2012, the number of
	Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares available for issuance under the 7Road 2012 Share Incentive Plan was increased to 15,100,000 shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On
	June&nbsp;28, 2013, 7Road&#146;s Board of Directors approved the cancellation of the 7Road 2012 Share Incentive Plan. 7Road concurrently offered to a total of 42 7Road employees holding an aggregate of 2,223,750 restricted share units which had been
	granted under the 7Road 2012 Share Incentive Plan the right to exchange their restricted share units for, at each employee&#146;s election, in each case subject to the employee&#146;s continued employment by 7Road, either (i)&nbsp;Scheme I: the
	right to a cash payment of up to an aggregate of $2.90 per restricted share unit exchanged, vesting and payable at the rate of 40%, 30% and 30%, respectively, on the first, second and third anniversaries of July&nbsp;18, 2012, which is the date when
	the surrendered restricted share units were granted under the 7Road 2012 Share Incentive Plan, or (ii)&nbsp;Scheme II: the right to receive an annual cash bonus, over a seven-year period commencing July&nbsp;1, 2013, based on the adjusted annual
	cumulative net income of 7Road. All restricted share units held by these 42 holders under the 7Road 2012 Share Incentive Plan as of June&nbsp;28, 2013 were included in this exchange program. In the third quarter of 2013, 7Road granted to an
	additional 48 7Road employees the right to receive an annual cash bonus under Scheme II with the same terms as described above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On
	August&nbsp;17, 2015, we completed the sale of the 7Road business. As of August&nbsp;17, 2015, we had recognized an aggregate of $4.2 million of compensation expense for Scheme I and $0.7&nbsp;million of compensation expense for Scheme II. As a
	result of the sale, there will be no additional compensation expense recognized for 7Road.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Employee Incentive Plans
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On February&nbsp;8, 2014, our Board of Directors approved three new employee incentive plans with terms of 10 years, commencing January&nbsp;1,
	2014. Under two of these three plans, we could have distributed cash compensation of up to 10% of our company-wide annual net profits after certain adjustments. The third employee incentive plan was structured to allow eligible employees to receive
	up to 20% of the annual adjusted net profits of projects that they worked on. In December 2014, our management reassessed the estimated compensation expense related to these three employee incentive plans and we reversed accruals associated with the
	compensation expense previously recognized for these plans in a total amount of $32.2 million. Our management also recommended cancelling the three employee incentive plans, and replacing them with a new cash bonus plan commencing in 2015. Our Board
	of Directors approved the cancellation of the three incentive plans on February&nbsp;7, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Issuance of Restricted Shares and
	Restricted Share Units to Executive Officers
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&nbsp;15, 2009, 8,000,000 Class B restricted shares were issued out of
	Sohu.com (Game) Limited&#146;s equity interest in us to Prominence Investments Ltd., or Prominence, a British Virgin Islands company beneficially owned by Tao Wang, our former Chief Executive Officer. The restricted shares were subject to vesting
	over a four-year period commencing on February&nbsp;1, 2008, and were subject to forfeiture to Sohu.com (Game) Limited if the vesting conditions were not met. All of such Class&nbsp;B restricted shares had become vested as of the date of this annual
	report. Also see &#147;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Operating Expenses&#151;Share-based Compensation Expense&#148; in Item&nbsp;5.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&nbsp;15, 2009, we issued to our then executive officers other than Tao Wang an aggregate of 1,800,000 of our Class&nbsp;B
	restricted shares under our 2008 Share Incentive Plan. On March&nbsp;13, 2009, we exchanged these Class B restricted shares for restricted share units (settleable in Class&nbsp;B ordinary shares). The vesting of these restricted share units was
	contingent upon the completion of an initial public offering by us on an internationally recognized stock exchange, and the restricted share units are otherwise subject to vesting over a four-year period, subject to acceleration under certain
	circumstances, commencing February&nbsp;1, 2008. On April&nbsp;21, 2009, we granted to our then executive officers other than Tao Wang an aggregate of 1,200,000 of our Class&nbsp;A restricted share units under our 2008 Share Incentive Plan. These
	restricted share units are subject to vesting over a four-year period and will be forfeited to us if the vesting conditions are not met. See &#147;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Operating Expenses&#151;Share-based Compensation
	Expense&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On November&nbsp;2, 2014, we granted to Dewen Chen, our Co-Chief Executive Officer and Xiaojian Hong, our Chief Operating
	Officer, an aggregate of 1,200,000 of our Class&nbsp;A restricted share units under our 2014 Share incentive Plan. These restricted share units are subject to vesting over a four-year period and will be forfeited to us if the vesting conditions are
	not met. On February&nbsp;16, 2015, our Board of Directors approved the conversion of 2,400,000 Class&nbsp;A restricted share units into options for the purchase of Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares at an exercise price of $0.01. See &#147;Operating and
	Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Operating Expenses&#151;Share-based Compensation Expense&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	85
</P>

	units to our directors and executive officers pursuant to our 2008 Share Incentive Plan.
</P>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Originally granted in the form of restricted share units settleable in Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares, which are subject to vesting over a four-year period and will be forfeited to us if the vesting conditions are not
	met. On February&nbsp;16, 2015, our Board of Directors approved the conversion of the restricted share units into options for the purchase of Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares at an exercise price of $0.01, subject to the same vesting conditions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Board of Directors
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Board of Directors currently consists of Dr.&nbsp;Charles Zhang, Carol Yu, Dave De Yang, Xiao Chen and Charles Chan. Our directors are
	elected by the holders of our ordinary shares and will hold office until our next annual general meeting of shareholders and until their successors are duly elected or appointed, or until their resignation or removal in accordance with the
	provisions of our memorandum and articles of association. A director is not required to hold any shares in our company by way of qualification. A&nbsp;director may vote with respect to any contract, proposed contract or arrangement in which he is
	materially interested provided that the nature of such interest is disclosed prior to any vote thereon. A director may exercise all the powers of our company to borrow money, mortgage or charge our undertakings, property and uncalled capital or any
	part thereof, and issue debentures or other securities whether outright or as security for any debt, liability or obligation of our company or of any third party.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A company of which more than 50% of the voting power is held by a single entity is considered a &#147;controlled company&#148; under the
	Nasdaq Listing Rules. A controlled company need not comply with the applicable Nasdaq corporate governance rules requiring its Board of Directors to have a majority of independent directors and independent compensation and corporate governance and
	nominating committees. Because more than 50% of the voting power of our company is held by Sohu, we qualify as a &#147;controlled company&#148; under the Nasdaq Listing Rules, and we avail ourselves of the controlled company exception provided under
	those rules. In the event that we are no longer a controlled company, a majority of our Board of Directors will be required to be independent and it will be necessary for us to have compensation and corporate governance and nominating committees
	that are composed entirely of independent directors, subject to a phase-in period during the first year we cease to be a controlled company, unless we invoke the home country exception to such requirement available to foreign private issuers, such
	as us, under the Nasdaq Listing Rules.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Committees of the Board of Directors
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Audit Committee.
</I>
	&nbsp;Our audit committee currently consists of Dave De Yang, Xiao Chen and Charles Chan. Our Board of Directors has
	determined that Dave De Yang, Xiao Chen and Charles Chan satisfy the independence requirements of Rule&nbsp;10A-3 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Rule 5605 of the Nasdaq Listing Rules. In addition, our Board of Directors has determined
	that Dave De Yang meets the criteria of an audit committee financial expert as set forth under the applicable SEC rules and Rule&nbsp;5605(c)(2) of the Nasdaq Listing Rules. The full responsibilities of our audit committee are set forth in its
	charter, which will be reviewed and updated annually and approved by our board, and will be posted on our Website at www.changyou.com. The audit committee is responsible for, among other things:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	selecting the independent auditors and pre-approving all auditing and non-auditing services permitted to be performed by the independent auditors;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	86
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Duties of Directors
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under Cayman Islands law, our directors have a common law duty&nbsp;to act honestly in good faith with a view to our best interests and for a
	proper purpose. Our directors also have a duty to exercise the skill they actually possess with the care and diligence that a reasonably prudent person would exercise in comparable circumstances. In fulfilling their duty of care to us, our directors
	must ensure compliance with our memorandum and articles of association. A shareholder may have the right to seek various remedies, including damages on behalf of our company, if a duty owed by our directors is breached.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Terms of Directors and Officers
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A director may be removed by ordinary resolution passed by a majority of our shareholders before the expiration of such director&#146;s term.
	Officers are elected by and serve at the discretion of the Board of Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Employees
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had approximately 3,262 full-time and part-time employees. None of our employees are represented under
	collective bargaining agreements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>

</I>
</B>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62578D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Includes the number of Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares and percentage ownership represented by Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares determined to be beneficially owned by a person or entity in accordance with rules of the SEC.
	Holders of Class B ordinary shares may convert their Class B ordinary shares into the same number of Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares at any time and, accordingly, are deemed to beneficially own such Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares. The number of
	Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares or Class B ordinary shares beneficially owned by a person or entity includes restricted share units and/or share options that will vest within 60 days after the date of this report. Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares or Class
	B ordinary shares issuable upon the vesting of restricted share units are deemed outstanding for the purpose of computing the percentage of outstanding Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares owned by that person or entity. Such Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares or
	Class B ordinary shares issuable upon such vesting are not deemed outstanding, however, for the purpose of computing the percentage ownership of any other person or entity.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Data based on a Schedule 13G/A filed with the SEC on February 16, 2016. Consists of 10,351,270 Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares, represented by 5,175,635 ADSs,&nbsp;held by Prominence. Prominence is a&nbsp;British Virgin
	Islands&nbsp;company which is ultimately owned by a trust of which Tao Wang, our former Chief Executive Officer, is the primary beneficiary. The business address of Prominence Investments Ltd. is c/o Credit Suisse Trust,&nbsp;Singapore,
	1&nbsp;Raffles Link #05-02,&nbsp;Singapore.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Consists of 1,500,000 Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares, which are represented by 750,000 ADSs, and 70,250,000 Class B ordinary shares held by Sohu.com (Game) Limited. Sohu.com (Game) Limited, a Cayman Islands corporation
	and an indirect wholly-owned subsidiary of Sohu.com Inc. The registered address of Sohu.com (Game) Limited is Floor 4, Willow House, Cricket Square, P&nbsp;O&nbsp;Box 2804, Grand Cayman KY1-1112, Cayman Islands. The Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares
	(represented by ADSs) and the Class&nbsp;B ordinary shares held by Sohu.com (Game) Ltd. collectively represent approximately 83.0% of the voting power of all issued and outstanding ordinary shares of Changyou.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our ordinary shares are divided into Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares and Class B ordinary shares. With respect to matters requiring a shareholder
	vote, holders of Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares and holders of Class B ordinary shares vote together as one class. Each Class&nbsp;A ordinary share is entitled to one vote and each Class B ordinary share is entitled to ten votes. We issued
	Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares represented by our ADSs in our initial public offering. Holders of Class B ordinary shares may choose to convert their Class&nbsp;B ordinary shares into the same number of Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares at any time. Class
	B ordinary shares are only transferable to an affiliate of the holder or to an affiliate of us.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All of the 34,239,420 Class&nbsp;A
	ordinary shares issued and outstanding as of the date of this report, or approximately 32.8% of the combined total of our outstanding Class&nbsp;A and Class B ordinary shares, were held by a single holder of record in the United States, the Bank of
	New York Mellon, the depositary for our ADS program.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Related Party Transactions
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of the date of this report, Sohu held approximately 68.7% of the combined total of Changyou&#146;s outstanding Class&nbsp;A and Class B
	ordinary shares and controlled approximately 95.6% of the total voting power in Changyou. As of the date of this report, Sohu continues to have the power acting alone to approve any action requiring a vote of the majority of our ordinary shares and
	to elect all our directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Contractual Arrangements with our VIEs and their Shareholders
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	PRC law currently restricts foreign ownership of online game businesses. To comply with PRC law, we conduct a significant part of our online
	games and platform channel businesses through contractual arrangements between our principal PRC subsidiaries AmazGame, Gamespace and Beijing Baina Technology and their corresponding VIEs Gamease, Guanyou Gamespace and Wuhan Baina Information and
	their respective shareholders. See &#147;Information on the Company&#151;Organizational Structure&#148; in Item&nbsp;4 of this annual report for a description of the ownership information of our current principal VIEs. Upon the completion of our
	sale of Shenzhen 7Road on August 17, 2015, all VIE contractual arrangements between Shenzhen 7Road, its corresponding PRC subsidiary Shenzhen 7Road Network Technologies Co., Ltd. and Gamease, which was the sole shareholder of Shenzhen 7Road,
	terminated. In October 2015, our VIE Gamease acquired from our employees Runa Pi and Rong Qi 100% of the equity interests in Shanghai ICE. As Shanghai ICE as a result of these transfer is now a wholly-owned subsidiary of Gamease, the VIE contractual
	arrangements for Shanghai ICE no longer necessary and have been terminated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following is a summary of the agreements currently in
	effect between these principal PRC subsidiaries and our principal VIEs:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Contractual Arrangements with Gamease and its Sole Shareholder
	High Century
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Loan Agreement
</I>
	, between AmazGame and Gamease&#146;s sole shareholder High Century. This loan agreement provides for a loan in the amount of RMB10,000,000 (approximately $1,520,000) to High Century to make a
	contribution to the registered capital of Gamease in exchange for 100% of the equity interests in Gamease. The loan is interest free and is repayable on demand, but the shareholder can only repay the loan by transferring to AmazGame all of the
	equity interests in Gamease.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	88
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Equity Interest Purchase Right Agreement
</I>
	, among AmazGame, Gamease and High Century. Pursuant to this agreement, AmazGame and any third party designated by AmazGame have the right, exercisable at any time during
	the term of the agreement, if and when it is legal to do so under PRC law, to purchase from High Century all or any part of its equity interests in Gamease at a purchase price equal to its initial contribution to the registered capital of Gamease.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Equity Pledge Agreements
</I>
	, among AmazGame, Gamease and High Century. Pursuant to this agreement, High Century pledged to AmazGame its equity interests in Gamease to secure the performance of its obligations and
	Gamease&#146;s obligations under the various VIE-related agreements. If High Century breaches its obligations under any VIE-related agreements (Gamease&#146;s breach of any of its obligations under the various VIE-related agreements will be treated
	as High Century&#146;s breach of its obligations), including the Equity Pledge Agreement, AmazGame is entitled to exercise its rights as the beneficiary under the Equity Pledge Agreement, including all rights High Century has as a shareholder of
	Gamease.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Business Operation Agreement
</I>
	, among AmazGame, Gamease and High Century. This agreement sets forth the rights of AmazGame to control the actions of Gamease and Gamease&#146;s sole shareholder High Century.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Power of Attorney
</I>
	, executed by High Century in favor of AmazGame. This power of attorney gives the board of directors of AmazGame the exclusive right to appoint nominees to act on behalf of High Century in
	connection with all actions to be taken by Gamease.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Technology Support and Utilization Agreement
</I>
	, between AmazGame and Gamease. Pursuant to this agreement, AmazGame has the exclusive right to provide certain product development and application services and
	technology support to Gamease for a fee equal to a predetermined percentage of Gamease&#146;s revenues.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Services and Maintenance Agreement
</I>
	, between AmazGame and Gamease. Pursuant to this agreement, AmazGame provides marketing, staffing, business operation and maintenance services to Gamease in exchange for a fee
	equal to the cost of providing such services plus a predetermined margin.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Contractual Arrangements with Guanyou
	Gamespace and its Sole Shareholder Changyou Star
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Loan Agreement
</I>
	, between Gamespace and Guanyou Gamespace&#146;s sole shareholder Changyou Star. This loan agreement provides for a loan in the amount of RMB10,000,000 (approximately $1,520,000) to Changyou Star to
	make a contribution to the registered capital of Guanyou Gamespace in exchange for 100% of the equity interests in Guanyou Gamespace. The loan is interest free and is repayable on demand, but Changyou Star can only repay the loan by transferring to
	Gamespace the equity interests in Guanyou Gamespace.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Equity Interest Purchase Right Agreement
</I>
	, among Gamespace, Guanyou Gamespace and Changyou Star. Pursuant to this agreement, Gamespace and any third party designated by Gamespace have the right, exercisable at any
	time during the term of the agreement, if and when it is legal to do so under PRC law, to purchase from Changyou Star all or any part of its equity interests in Guanyou Gamespace at a purchase price equal to its initial contribution to the
	registered capital of Guanyou Gamespace.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Equity Pledge Agreements
</I>
	, among Gamespace, Guanyou Gamespace and Changyou Star. Pursuant to this agreement, Changyou Star pledged to Gamespace its equity interests in Guanyou Gamespace to secure the performance
	of its obligations and Guanyou Gamespace&#146;s obligations under the various VIE-related agreements. If Changyou Star breaches its obligations under any VIE-related agreements (Guanyou Gamespace&#146;s breach of any of its obligations under the
	various VIE-related agreements will be treated as Changyou Star&#146;s breach of its obligations), including the Equity Pledge Agreement, Gamespace is entitled to exercise its rights as the beneficiary under the Equity Pledge Agreement, including
	all rights Changyou Star has as a shareholder of Guanyou Gamespace.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Business Operation Agreement
</I>
	, among Gamespace, Guanyou Gamespace and Changyou Star. This agreement sets forth the rights of Gamespace to control the actions of Guanyou Gamespace and its sole shareholder Changyou
	Star.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Power of Attorney
</I>
	, executed by Changyou Star in favor of Gamespace. This power of attorney gives the board of directors of Gamespace the exclusive right to appoint nominees to act on behalf of Changyou Star as
	the sole shareholder of Guanyou Gamespace in connection with all actions to be taken by Guanyou Gamespace.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Technology Support and Utilization Agreement
</I>
	, between Gamespace and Guanyou Gamespace. Pursuant to this agreement, Gamespace has the exclusive right to provide certain product development and application services
	and technology support to Guanyou Gamespace for a fee equal to a predetermined percentage of Guanyou Gamespace&#146;s revenues.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

</I>
	, between Gamespace and Guanyou Gamespace. Pursuant to this agreement, Gamespace provides marketing, staffing, business operation and maintenance services to Guanyou Gamespace in
	exchange for a fee equal to the cost of providing such services plus a predetermined margin.
</TD>

</TABLE>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Equity Pledge Agreement,
</I>
	between Beijing Baina Technology and the shareholders of Wuhan Baina Information, which are Changyou Star and Yongzhi Yang. Pledge by the Changyou Star and Yongzhi Yang to Beijing Baina
	Technology of their equity interests in Wuhan Baina Information to secure the performance of their respective obligations and Wuhan Baina Information&#146;s obligations under the various VIE-related agreements. If Wuhan Baina Information or any of
	the shareholders of Wuhan Baina Information breaches its or his obligations under any VIE-related agreements, Being Baina Technology is entitled to exercise its rights as pledgee of the equity interests.

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Exclusive Call Option Agreement,
</I>
	among Beijing Baina Technology, Changyou Star, Wuhan Baina Information and Yongzhi Yang. Provides to Beijing Baina Technology and any third party designated by Beijing Baina
	Technology the right, exercisable at any time during the term of the agreement, if and when it is legal to do so under PRC law, to purchase from Changyou Star and Yongzhi Yang all or any part of their shares in Wuhan Baina Information or to purchase
	from Wuhan Baina Information all or part of its assets or business at the lower of RMB1.00 (approximately $0.15) or the lowest purchase price permissible under PRC law.
</TD>

</TABLE>

	equipment lease, market consulting, integration of systems, research and development of products and maintenance of systems. Service fees are to be determined with reference to the specific services provided, based on a transfer pricing analysis.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Transactions and Agreements with Sohu in connection with the carve-out of our client-end installed MMORPG Business from Sohu
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Expenses charged from Sohu for sales and marketing services and certain other services in connection with our business amounted to
	$2.7 million, $10.4 million and $13.4 million, respectively, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013. The amounts of these charges were agreed to by Sohu and us with reference to amounts charged for similar services by unrelated
	parties. Total corporate general administrative expenses allocated from Sohu were $nil, $15,000 and $12,000, respectively, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During the past few years, we have continued to use the Sohu logo, to purchase banner advertisements from Sohu, and, before our acquisition of
	the assets associated with the 17173.com Website from Sohu on December&nbsp;15, 2011, to pay Sohu to include advertisements for and links to our PC games on the 17173.com Website. For each of such banner advertisement and link placements, we paid
	Sohu at the same rates as Sohu charges third parties for such placements. We also used Sohu&#146;s PEAK online billing system and used Sohu to provide links to our PC game Website on Sohu.com&#146;s main Website, for which we paid Sohu at a rate
	comparable to the rates charged by third-party providers for similar services and placements. In 2015, for so long as Sohu remains as our controlling shareholder, we intend to enter into new agreements, or make amendments to existing agreements,
	between us and Sohu that involve significant expenditures or commitments with reference to the terms of similar agreements between unrelated third parties. We will also submit such agreements and amendments for review by the audit committee of our
	Board of Directors, which will assess such agreements and amendments for potential conflicts of interest in accordance with the Nasdaq Listing Rules, and seek to ensure that terms of such agreements and amendments are no less favorable than would be
	comparable agreements between us and an unrelated third party. We have adopted a policy for our audit committee setting forth the guidelines under which related party transactions, including transactions between Sohu and us, must be reviewed and
	approved or ratified by the audit committee. In assessing a related party transaction, the audit committee is required to consider such factors as (i)&nbsp;the benefits to us of the transaction; (ii)&nbsp;the commercial reasonableness of the terms
	of the related party transaction; (iii)&nbsp;the materiality of the transaction to us; and (iv)&nbsp;the extent of the related party&#146;s interest in the transaction.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following are summaries of an Amended and Restated Non-Competition Agreement, and an Amended and Restated Marketing Services Agreement
	between Sohu and us:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	90
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage93"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62578D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Amended and Restated Non-Competition Agreement
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We are a party to a Non-Competition Agreement, effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2009 and amended and restated as of November&nbsp;29, 2011,
	pursuant to which Sohu has agreed that, (i)&nbsp;until the later of three years after Sohu no longer owns in the aggregate at least 10% of the voting power of our then outstanding voting securities and March&nbsp;17, 2014, or the general
	non-competition period, Sohu will not compete with us in the client-end installed&nbsp;MMORPG business anywhere in the world, and (ii)&nbsp;until December&nbsp;15, 2016, or the 17173 non-competition period, Sohu will not compete with us in the
	17173.com Website anywhere in the world, except that Sohu may, during the 17173 non-competition period, continue to own and operate a Web site through the domain name &#147;games.sohu.com,&#148; for so long as content for and maintenance of such
	site is primarily provided by our staff. We have agreed during the general non-competition period not to compete with Sohu in the Internet portal, search, mobile value-added services and any other businesses conducted or contemplated to be conducted
	by Sohu as of April&nbsp;1, 2009, except the client-end installed&nbsp;MMORPG business and, after our acquisition of the 17173.com Website on December&nbsp;15, 2011, the 17173.com Website. In addition, both parties have agreed not to solicit the
	employees of the other party.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Amended and Restated Marketing Services Agreement
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We entered into a Marketing Services Agreement with Sohu, effective January&nbsp;1, 2009, amended and restated as of January&nbsp;1, 2010 and
	further amended as of January&nbsp;1, 2011, pursuant to which Sohu provides certain rights and services to us, including marketing services and Sohu&#146;s PEAK system for the distribution of our virtual prepaid game cards. The agreement further
	provides for the license from Sohu to us of certain domain names, permits us to co-brand our games with the Sohu name and logos, and allows us to identify ourselves as a member of the Sohu Group. The agreement will terminate upon the later of the
	date that is three years after the first date upon which Sohu ceases to own in the aggregate at least 10% of the voting power of the then outstanding securities of Changyou and the fifth anniversary of March&nbsp;17, 2009. The amendment and
	restatement of the Marketing Services Agreement effective January&nbsp;1, 2010 includes certain amendments to the original agreement, including clarifications and rate adjustments, and terms under which Sohu provides us with space on Sohu servers
	for the purpose of our display on Sohu Websites of banner ads and promotional material, continues to give us rights to use the Sohu brand and logo, certain Sohu domain names, Sohu Passport and the Sohu PEAK online payment system, and provides
	certain services to us, such as the construction and maintenance of a bulletin board system for some of our PC games.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Termination
	Agreement with Former Chief Executive Officer
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Board of Directors accepted Mr.&nbsp;Tao Wang&#146;s resignation as our Chief
	Executive Officer effective November&nbsp;2, 2014 and Mr.&nbsp;Wang resigned from our Board of Directors effective January&nbsp;15, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We entered into a termination agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Wang effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2015 pursuant to which Mr.&nbsp;Wang confirmed that
	he submitted his resignation as our Chief Executive Officer on November&nbsp;1, 2014, and from all other positions with us (including with any of our subsidiaries and VIEs) upon the execution of the termination agreement. Mr.&nbsp;Wang has also
	confirmed that he, as a shareholder of our VIEs, will cooperate with us to timely transfer all of his equity interests in those VIEs to a replacement shareholder designated by us. Pursuant to the termination agreement, we paid to Mr.&nbsp;Wang a
	one-time payment of RMB 7,380,000 (or approximately $1.2 million) and agreed that his existing Executive Employee Non-Competition, Non-Solicitation, Confidential Information and Work Product Agreement terminated effective December&nbsp;31, 2014.
	Mr.&nbsp;Wang agreed to provide consulting services to us during a period between January&nbsp;1, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2015. During the consulting period, in consideration for Mr.&nbsp;Wang&#146;s consulting services, Mr.&nbsp;Wang will be
	entitled to receive the same benefits, in kind or in equivalent amounts, as were made available to him immediately prior to the termination of his employment with us.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Matching Loans Arrangement between Sohu and Changyou
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During 2015, certain of our subsidiaries and certain Sohu subsidiaries entered into a series of one year loan agreements, pursuant to which our
	subsidiaries are entitled to draw down U.S. dollar-denominated loans from the Sohu subsidiaries and the Sohu subsidiaries are entitled to draw down equivalent RMB-denominated loans from our subsidiaries, to facilitate each other&#146;s business
	operations. All of the loans carry a fixed rate of interest equal to the current market interest rate as of the date when the loan agreements were entered into. As of December 31, 2015, we had drawn down from Sohu subsidiaries loans in an aggregate
	principal amount of $170 million and Sohu had drawn down from our subsidiaries loans in an aggregate principal amount of RMB1.02 billion (approximately $157.1 million) For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, interest income that we earned from
	such RMB-denominated loans was $4.9 million, and interest expense that we accrued for such U.S. dollar-denominated loans was $1.2 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	91
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Matching Loans Arrangement between Changyou and SoEasy
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During 2015, certain of our subsidiaries and certain subsidiaries of SoEasy Internet Finance Group Limited (&#147;SoEasy&#148;) entered into a
	series of one year loan agreements, pursuant to which our subsidiaries are entitled to draw down Hong Kong dollar-denominated loans up to HK$100 million (approximately $12.9 million) from SoEasy and the subsidiaries of SoEasy are entitled to draw
	down equivalent RMB-denominated loans from our subsidiaries, to facilitate each other&#146;s business operations. All of the loans carry a fixed rate of interest equal to the current market interest rate as of the date when the loan agreements were
	entered into. As of December 31, 2015, we had drawn down from SoEasy loans in an aggregate principal amount of HK$100 million (approximately $12.9 million) and SoEasy had drawn down from our loans in an aggregate principal amount of RMB80 million
	(approximately $12.3&nbsp;million). For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, interest income that we earned from the RMB-denominated loans was $0.4 million, and interest expense that we accrued for the Hong Kong dollar-denominated loans was $0.1
	million.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D62578D20F_HTM_TX62578_10">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;8. FINANCIAL INFORMATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Please see Item&nbsp;18 &#147;Financial Statements&#148; for our audited consolidated financial statements filed as a part of this annual
	report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Legal Proceedings
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We may be subject to legal proceedings, investigations and claims incidental to the conduct of our business from time to time. We are not
	currently a party to, nor are we aware of, any legal proceeding, investigation or claim which, in the opinion of our management, is likely to have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition or results of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Dividend Policy
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2013, 2014 and 2015, we did not declare or pay any dividends. In August 2012, our Board of Directors declared a special one-time cash
	dividend of $1.90 per Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares or Class B ordinary share, or $3.80 per ADS (each representing two Class&nbsp;A ordinary shares). The total amount of the special cash dividend was approximately $200.9 million. In order to expedite
	the payment of the special cash dividend, we financed the payment through loans from offshore banks which are secured by an equivalent amount of RMB-denominated onshore bank deposits of our subsidiaries in China. The dividend was paid to our
	shareholders on September&nbsp;21, 2012.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Future cash dividends, if any, will be declared at the sole discretion of our Board of Directors
	and will depend upon our future operations and earnings, capital requirements and surplus, general financial condition, contractual restrictions and other factors as our Board of Directors may deem relevant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Holders of ADSs will be entitled to receive dividends, subject to the terms of the deposit agreement, to the same extent as the holders of our
	ordinary shares, less the fees and expenses payable under the deposit agreement. Cash dividends will be paid by the depositary to holders of ADSs in U.S. dollars, subject to the terms of the deposit agreement. Other distributions, if any, will be
	paid by the depositary to holders of ADSs in any means it deems legal, fair and practical.
</P>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_LISTING>
<A NAME="FIS_LISTING"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D62578D20F_HTM_TX62578_11">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;9. THE OFFER AND LISTING
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our ADSs are listed on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol &#147;CYOU.&#148; Trading in our ADSs commenced on
	April&nbsp;2, 2009.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table provides the high and low reported sale prices for our ADSs on the Nasdaq Global Select Market
	for (1)&nbsp;the five most recent fiscal years (2)&nbsp;each quarter in the two most recent fiscal years, (3)&nbsp;each of the last six full months, and (4)&nbsp;the month of February 2016 through February&nbsp;19, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	92
</P>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
